ResourceHeader.Description:
AJ4CO Observatory in High Springs, Florida is a participant in the Radio JOVE project providing observations of radio emissions from Jupiter, the Sun, and the Galactic Background to other members of the Radio JOVE community. The observatory consists of a TFD (Terminated Folded Dipole) array and a Radio JOVE dipole array which feed a variety of receiver systems including a Dual-Polarization Spectrograph (DPS), a Tunable Wideband Receiver (TWB), a FS-200B radio spectrograph, and Radio JOVE receivers.
The TFD array consists of two square arrays on a NS line, eight 30-foot TFD elements with beam steering in 5 degree increments NS and 15 degree increments EW.

InformationURL.Description: This site provide station diagrams and other reports for the receiver systems at several radio observatories associated with the Radio JOVE project

ResourceHeader.ResourceName: AJ4CO Terminated Folded Dipole and Dual-Radio JOVE receiver system

RevisionEvent.Note: RadioJOVE: Update obsolete radiojove.gsfc.nasa.gov and www.typnet.net URLs, Resource Header Description reformated. Metadata submitted by J.M. Weygand on 2022-02-11, reviewed by LFB

ResourceHeader.Description:
Terminated Folded Dipole and Dual-Radio JOVE receiver system at the AJ4CO Radio Astronomy Observatory in High Springs, Florida.
The TFD array consists of two 4-element (32 foot) square array. Each antenna element is 32 feet long. TFD array is aligned to true north. The Dual-Radio JOVE receiver system operates with two separate Radio JOVE receivers at 20.1 MHz providing uncorrelated RCP and LCP.
See the Information URL for a link to a document providing additional descriptions of the instrument characteristics.

ResourceHeader.ResourceName: AJ4CO Terminated Folded Dipole and Tunable Wideband Receiver system

RevisionEvent.Note: RadioJOVE: Update obsolete radiojove.gsfc.nasa.gov and www.typnet.net URLs, Resource Header Description reformated. Metadata submitted by J.M. Weygand on 2022-02-11, reviewed by LFB

ResourceHeader.Description:
Terminated Folded Dipole and Tunable Wideband Receiver system at the AJ4CO Radio Astronomy Observatory, High Springs, Florida.
The TFD array consists of two 4-element (32 foot) square array. Each antenna element is 32 feet long. Bandwidth is 2 MHz. Polarization is simulataneous RCP and LCP. TFD array is aligned to true north. The FSX-8S spectrograph operates at 17-33 MHz simultaneous RCP and LCP.
See the Information URL for a link to a document providing additional descriptions of the instrument characteristics.

ResourceHeader.ResourceName: AJ4CO Terminated Folded Dipole and Dual-Polarization Spectrograph system

RevisionEvent.Note: RadioJOVE: Update obsolete radiojove.gsfc.nasa.gov and www.typnet.net URLs, Resource Header Description reformated. Metadata submitted by J.M. Weygand on 2022-02-11, reviewed by LFB

ResourceHeader.Description:
Terminated Folded Dipole and Dual Polarization Spectrograph system at the AJ4CO Radio Astronomy Observatory in High Springs, Florida.
The TFD array consists of two 4-element (32 foot) square array. Each antenna element is 32 feet long. Polarization is simulataneous RCP and LCP. TFD array is aligned to true north. The Dual-Polarization Spectrograph operates at 16 -32 MHz simultaneous RCP and LCP providing 300 channels per polarization (600 total). It is a swept frequency reeiver selectable 7.5, 15, 30, 60 kHz pre-detection bandwidth, ~6.7 sweeps/sec, integration time 500 microseconds per sample. The frequency resolution is 53 kHz, delta-T is 150 milliseconds.
See the Information URL for a link to a document providing additional descriptions of the instrument characteristics.

ResourceHeader.ResourceName: AJ4CO Dual Dipole Array and RadioJOVE receiver system

ResourceHeader.Description:
RadioJOVE Dual Dipole Array and RadioJOVE receiver system at the AJ4CO Radio Astronomy Observatory in High Springs, Florida. This is a 2 element array separated by 20 feet. Each antenna element is 25 feet long. Polarization is linear. The array is aligned to magnetic north. The RadioJOVE direct conversion receiver has a 7 KHz RF bandwidth and operates at 20.1 MHz.
See the Information URL for a link to a document providing additional descriptions of the instrument characteristics.

ResourceHeader.Description:
Terminated Folded Dipole and FS-200B Radio Spectrograph system at the AJ4CO Radio Astronomy Observatory in High Springs, Florida.
The TFD array consists of two 4-element (32 foot) square array. Each antenna element is 32 feet long. Polarization is simulataneous RCP and LCP. TFD array is aligned to true north. The FS-200B Radio Spectrograph operates at 16 - 26 MHz either RCP or LCP.
See the Information URL for a link to a document providing additional descriptions of the instrument characteristics.
